place.name: CLIXBY
place.gazetteerText: CLIXBY, a chapelry in Caistor parish, Lincoln; on the Wolds, 2 miles N by W of Caistor, and 4½ ENE of North Kelsey r. station. Post town, Caistor. Real property, £1, 890. Pop., 27. Houses, 5. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Caistor, in the diocese of Lincoln. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
